  • Scanner

Class Scanner

Basic use:

var videoReader = new dynamsoft.BarcodeReader.Scanner({
  onFrameRead:function(results){console.log(results);},
  onNewCodeRead:function(txt, result){alert(txt);}
});
videoReader.open();

Properties

bAddOriVideoCanvasToResult

bAddOriVideoCanvasToResult: boolean
  • Defined in dbr-wasm.d.ts:369

Whether show oriVideoCanvas in result.

bAddSearchRegionCanvasToResult

bAddSearchRegionCanvasToResult: boolean
  • Defined in dbr-wasm.d.ts:373

Whether show searchRegionCanvas in result.

confidence

confidence: number
  • Defined in dbr-wasm.d.ts:349

This property is mainly related to 1D barcodes. If the confidence of a 1D barcode result is greater than or equal to this confidence, that is a reliable result that might cause onNewCodeRead. Otherwise if the confidence of a result is smaller than this confidence, the result will be ignored by onNewCodeRead. Default 30.

duplicateForgetTime

duplicateForgetTime: number
  • Defined in dbr-wasm.d.ts:381

The amount of time the reader "remembers" a barcode result once a single frame is read. Once the barcode result is obtained, the scanner will not trigger onNewCodeRead for the specific barcode again until forgetTime is up.

htmlElement

htmlElement: HTMLElement
  • Defined in dbr-wasm.d.ts:335

The HTML element that will contain the scanner object should you choose to customize the UI. It will have a simple default UI if you keep htmlElement undefined in initialization config.

intervalTime

intervalTime: number
  • Defined in dbr-wasm.d.ts:353

The time interval after the result is found in once reading and before the decoding begins in next reading. Default 100(ms).

isOpen

isOpen: function
  • Defined in dbr-wasm.d.ts:331

Type declaration

    • (): boolean

    • Returns boolean

Optional onFrameRead

onFrameRead: function
  • Defined in dbr-wasm.d.ts:377

The event that is triggered once a single frame has been scanned. The results object contains all the barcode results that the reader was able to decode.

Type declaration

    • (results: TextResult[]): void

    • Parameters

      • results: TextResult[]

      Returns void

Optional onNewCodeRead

onNewCodeRead: function
  • Defined in dbr-wasm.d.ts:385

This event is triggered when a not duplicated new barcode is found. txt holds the barcode text result. result contains the actual barcode result, including the text result. Old barcode will remember for duplicateForgetTime.

Type declaration

    • (txt: string, result: TextResult): void

    • Parameters

      • txt: string
      • result: TextResult

      Returns void

runtimeSettings

runtimeSettings: RuntimeSettings
  • Defined in dbr-wasm.d.ts:357

Defines the different settings of the barcode reader itself. Find a full list of these settings and their corresponding descriptions here.

searchRegion

searchRegion: ScannerSearchRegion
  • Defined in dbr-wasm.d.ts:365

Like {sx:0, sy:0, sWidth:200, sHeight:200, dWidth:200, dHeight:200}. Also see: drawImage. Or {sx: 0.2, sy: 0.2, sWidth: 0.6, sHeight: 0.6, dWidth: 0.6, dHeight: 0.6} to crop center 60% * 60% region. Another example, take a center 50% * 50% part of the video and resize the part to 25% * 25% of original video size before decode. {sx: 0.25, sy: 0.25, sWidth: 0.5, sHeight: 0.5, dWidth: 0.25, dHeight: 0.25}.

Optional videoSettings

videoSettings: MediaStreamConstraints
  • Defined in dbr-wasm.d.ts:342

Video play settings. Refer MediaStreamConstraints. Example: { video: { width: 1280, height: 720, facingMode: "environment" } }. If during reading, need close() then open() to make it effective.
